title: Biodiversity
synopsis: Biodiversity is the degree of variation of life. It is a measure of the variety of organisms present in different ecosystems.

title: Changes to the Bio-Commons
synopsis: Here we list pages that have changed related to biology, and the [[Bio-commons]]:

title: Currently Working On
synopsis: Here is a list of [[Recent Changes]] I consider important. View our experiments on the [[Scratch]] page. To clear stuff saved in your browser try [[Local Changes]].

title: Diversity
synopsis: Here I collect links and thoughts on the subject of "diversity". I've been surprised about how little is known about the [[Mathematics of Diversity]], and in particular [[Diversity Generation]].

title: Evolution of Biodiversity
synopsis: [[Biodiversity]] is the result of 3.5 billion years of evolution. Until approximately 600 million years ago, all life consisted of archaea, bacteria, protozoans and similar single-celled organisms.

title: Evolution of Sex
synopsis: The evolution of sexual reproduction describes how sexually reproducing eukaryotic organisms (animals, plants and fungi) evolved from a common ancestor that was a single celled eukaryotic species  - [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Evolution_of_sexual_reproduction wikipedia]

title: New Mexico in Triassic Pangea
synopsis: The Triassic period preceded the Jurassic period. It was the age when the dinosaurs came into being but not the age they dominated the landscape. The position of the continents at that time was considerably different than today. In the late Triassic, New Mexico would have been just 12 degrees north of the equator. [http://m.csmonitor.com/Science/2015/0615/What-made-large-dinosaurs-flee-the-tropics article]

title: Permian-Triassic Extinction
synopsis: The Permian–Triassic extinction event, colloquially known as [[The Great Dying]] occurred about 252 million years ago, forming the boundary between the Permian and Triassic geologic periods, as well as the Paleozoic and Mesozoic eras.

title: Polar Dinos
synopsis: Dinosaurs once dominated the world — but they spent their first 30 million years stranded on its geographic fringes. Large dinosaurs flourished near the poles, but only a few small ones, no larger than ostriches, managed to gain a foothold in the hotter low latitudes. [http://www.nature.com/news/extreme-climate-change-slowed-dinosaurs-rise-1.17728 nature]

title: The Great Dying
synopsis: The Great Dying is the common name for the [[Permian-Triassic Extinction]] Event that happened  250 million years ago - . [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Permian%E2%80%93Triassic_extinction_event wikipedia]

title: Welcome Visitors
synopsis: Welcome to this [[Federated Wiki]] site about the ancient history of [[Daisy World]] - from the beginning of time, through [[Pangea]] to the present.
